explanation: The condition compared s[i][0] (price of product i) to s[j][1] (the function count of product j) instead of to s[j][0] (the price of product j). I changed s[j][1] to s[j][0] so the price comparison uses the other product's price. This matches the intended condition P_i >= P_j (as in the referenced fix patterns).
fixed_code:
n,m=map(int,input().split())
s=[]
for i in range(n):
  p,c,*f=map(int,input().split())
  s.append([p,c,f])
for i in range(n):
  for j in range(n):
    if i!=j and s[i][0]>=s[j][0] and set(s[j][2])>=set(s[i][2]) \
            and (s[i][0]>s[j][0] or set(s[j][2])-set(s[i][2])):
      print("Yes")
      exit()
print("No")
